EBA62767345D4DE7850992F4BFE8D44F.description: demonstrate the effective use of business communication techniques (e.g., presentations, business reports, forms, charts) when developing, carrying out, and presenting their venture plan.

D9BB71928C984B3C8CD06289BA30594F.description: use appropriate information technology to produce their venture plan

E06ECE478F57410E8B00E7549368EDC2.description: revise the components of their venture plan (e.g., overview, production, marketing, and financial plans) and use them to produce a complete venture plan

80455FFC8BDA4DD4B49866ADBAC31C25.description: develop the overview of their venture plan (e.g., executive summary, mission statement, vision, goals)

07035951DAC143978DFF9F14DEC3DA3F.description: Completing the Venture Plan: produce, using appropriate software, a venture plan for their chosen venture.

FBB91163D87446AA8779CA123DAE0DBF.description: identify sources and methods of financing their chosen venture (e.g., government loans, private investors, bank loans, loans from family and friends, credit from suppliers).

E4268FEFBAC24B94B9A5C307B27FB864.description: calculate the start-up capital needed for their chosen venture

416F7AAD884C45C195F9BC6C7FF0964B.description: assess the importance of a cash-flow projection and create such a projection for their venture plan

6ADFAA54CEDC4093B39499A8DC134628.description: analyse specific financial goals for their chosen venture

887B31C4AF464D6C93629BCF984E36EE.description: analyse financial goals that an entrepreneur might establish for a new business venture (e.g., break-even point, projected profit levels, return on investment, market share)

499361F1A8EC4F3E869D38EA48296E2C.description: The Financial Plan: complete the components of an effective financial plan for their chosen venture

B5BA4C50D3934526807C74E8033CEB1B.description: describe the strategy used to determine the price for their new good or service.

8FC7A863800C46F7AA17EFD8116FB4D6.description: assess methods used to price a new good or service (e.g., cost-plus pricing, comparative pricing, psychological pricing) and determine which method is most appropriate for pricing their good or service

30C677890E1848BCBDF30D3829295D45.description: compare ways of advertising and promoting a venture (e.g., radio and TV commercials, print ads, flyers, coupons), and create appropriate advertisements and promotional strategies for their chosen venture

A5CD356E3EDF409BA13020D8D5A787FE.description: identify the most appropriate method to deliver their good or service

6F1B26863B6646D590F81D25A622E3CA.description: compare ways in which a specific good or service can be distributed to customers (e.g., direct channel, indirect channel, party method, vending machines)

9EE3B028A46C4F9EA3D0F56FE3640CD9.description: The Marketing Plan: complete the components of an effective marketing plan for their chosen venture

6DC0A8CF3BE249F4BF18F884AEE32AC5.description: identify the principles of inventory management and explain the importance of inventory management for an entrepreneur.

D3F0E0ADA3A54BF8B46E26AC4C20A77B.description: determine the goods (e.g., raw materials, supplies, equipment) and potential suppliers that are required for their chosen venture

C6B2D5806D6042598DFA52A12373ABBC.description: determine the production process that is most appropriate for their chosen venture

D7789DB30604443E82793C57E8B07313.description: describe the process involved in producing a new product or delivering a new service

3EFD1660CE4C484589B2FFACAD2A9299.description: The Production Plan: complete the components of an effective production plan for their chosen venture

F61C9F4C055E47D89BF589AFE6367DF9.description: compare the various forms of business ownership (e.g., sole proprietorship, partnership, corporation, cooperative, franchise) and determine which form is best suited to their proposed venture.

7F2708DA80D3494FB2D44758A25D7907.description: determine the human resource needs (e.g., employees, partners) for their proposed venture

A547AB9BAF7D4F3CA6F61535DDD1421F.description: identify and describe the applicable insurance and regulatory requirements that must be met in starting their proposed venture (e.g., liability insurance, principal's approval, permits, government registrations)

B69ADD43EB334C5FB35AE5990C912D44.description: determine what land, buildings, capital, equipment, and services are required to operate their proposed business venture

BEE2DC23945F4A929BC80842B4DC3BB1.description: Resource Analysis: analyse the resources required to run their chosen venture

F99DAC8A2E5B481FB85889EC2C6775AF.description: Developing and Completing a Venture Plan for the Proposed Business

B83AFA9BF0984C52A03D6A9C323658BD.description: explain how producing a thorough and accurate venture plan might reduce startup costs and financial risk.

8F113FC3D0704769A0FEBFF4B2809B9E.description: explain how people in the community (e.g., entrepreneurs, bankers, friends, and family) may contribute to the evaluation and revision of a venture plan

2D897789674541D49C9140CD9FA10950.description: forecast conditions that may require the revision of a venture plan

0AD7B362D1A643649EA250F0AFA4B6BE.description: describe why it is important for a venture plan to be flexible, ethical, and adaptable

003ED8ED8F7E42DC83324264CA5308AE.description: Evaluating and Revising a Venture Plan: explain how to evaluate and revise a venture plan.

7F602424BF434F58B991EE09B2774C13.description: use the computer to access the venture plan templates that are available from banks, government departments, and private companies to help prepare a venture plan.

6AC14E339CED46E8989CD73C9B4D0E24.description: describe sources of information and advice that may facilitate the preparation of a venture plan (e.g., local Business Enterprise Centres, National Council of Ethnic Canadian Business and Professional Associations,Aboriginal Business and Economic Development Organization, Canadian Women's Business Network)

4EA1086357CF4B2D81FB35AA32196664.description: identify and describe the components of a venture plan (e.g., executive summary, marketing research, resource analysis, production plan, marketing plan, financial plan)

3CC356EAED784FF3A3531D3772009C00.description: Components of a Venture Plan: analyse the structure and content of a venture plan

17B22AC488AC4721947D9726845FE73B.description: identify the people or organizations that might be interested in a venture plan (e.g., venture capitalists, financial institutions, investors)

07BC88930CFA4A70955B129161576641.description: explain the importance of having a plan that is organized according to a formal and accepted structure and is professionally presented

69B27D6270324113AF30C907578ABD6D.description: describe the purpose of a venture plan

3958799ABAE14F308AB9D8D1BCE09C58.description: The Importance of Having a Venture Plan: assess the importance of having a venture plan

C6F39D17AE8F4B7D9BA957D8AC381ABD.description: The Benefits of a Venture Plan

4AB7A985CC064274B4ABF92C68165FF0.description: evaluate the opportunity or idea for their proposed venture to determine its viability (e.g., availability of start-up capital, size of target market, technological feasibility, suitability for their personal skills and interests).

F7B5C659557C44AF92BE017E41FF30CF.description: identify the services required for the proposed venture (e.g., accounting, legal, consulting) and assess their potential impact on the venture

1E36D5E39F384A0B8D671358C3A6C9DF.description: identify and assess the potential competition for their proposed good or service (e.g., use SWOT analysis, PEST analysis, Porter's five forces model);

0F7CF8C4ADDC4F529195BC41126A7332.description: use appropriate sources (e.g., local school board, local chamber of commerce, Statistics Canada, city hall) to identify the characteristics (e.g., demographic, geographic, socio-economic) of potential target markets for their proposed good or service

3A185C90020F4C4B99707FC4626C170B.description: use methods of marketing research (e.g., primary and secondary) to determine whether demand exists for their proposed good or service (e.g., conduct a survey, record personal observation)

EEAF261515CF4E3DBB5467720B50947C.description: Evaluating an Idea or Opportunity for a Venture: conduct primary and secondary marketing research to evaluate the idea or opportunity for their proposed venture.

3CAF9CFBB122402D8EB25BE1EA1868C1.description: apply a decision-making model to select a feasible idea for a new good or service that can become the basis for a venture plan for a school-based or student-run business.

692F3A17F45C4235A102825DB3052795.description: use a variety of sources (e.g., books, magazines, personal observation, the Internet) to identify potential opportunities for new ventures in the school or the community

F2BAE0CFEA3F4C5797546BE0DDFF2957.description: apply creative-thinking strategies (e.g., mind mapping, brainstorming) to determine possible solutions to unsatisfied needs and wants in the school or the community

6341DDF2876E4D21A6CA7E2920170E3E.description: Generating Ideas and Identifying Opportunities: generate realistic new ideas and identify possible opportunities for a school-based or student-run business

D0AE4B23360C4AC5A222C6D5BB43342A.description: analyse, using a variety of sources (e.g., books, magazines, personal observation, the Internet), current economic trends (e.g., greater discretionary income of youth) and social trends (e.g., aging population, increasing cultural diversity) in order to generate ideas for new ventures.

EB1E495EE05945A2A4DCA43A969E460D.description: describe how similar needs and wants have been satisfied in different ways (e.g., alternative methods of healing, such as Aboriginal or Chinese methods, versus Western medicine; organic produce versus genetically modified produce)

C432BB1AFD5844FEAFFEB958983B86A2.description: explain how new ventures have been developed in response to consumer needs or wants

BCF6A53284754733A0AA5467C6660859.description: distinguish between an idea and an opportunity

E4E28CDD229E4C4D98D24B6DD2841EA9.description: Sources of Opportunities and Ideas: analyse various methods of generating ideas and identifying opportunities to satisfy needs and wants

191624AC22C94AD280F330C6890F54C4.description: describe how Canadian entrepreneurs have used inventions and/or innovations to start new ventures (e.g., Cirque du Soleil, Blissymbolics software).

211017428BDD4352A7CEAD463125AC85.description: describe the needs and wants that have been satisfied by Canadian inventions (e.g., goalie mask, Pablum) and innovations (e.g., disposable diapers, Fox 40 whistle)

AFDA12E05EFC4E979A8C41ABDFD250E7.description: distinguish between invention (e.g.,Velcro, the Internet, basketball) and innovation (e.g., coloured ketchup, cellphone, plasma screen TV)

6E422D7B5A1F4289838FA5E5C79E3F3E.description: Invention and Innovation: explain the importance of invention and innovation to venture creation

8479D8B7CF0A4F998DA1672B28C1A7AB.description: Ideas and Opportunities for New Ventures

ECA766996DB04937BFC67662AADB58A7.description: identify ways of measuring, evaluating, and developing their interest in potential enterprising and entrepreneurial careers (e.g., use the Internet, find a mentor, interview an entrepreneur).

5618B8DD0A5D4DEA96D4F89FFF7C0E12.description: conduct a self-assessment of their entrepreneurial characteristics and skills

2966E41B50B0494587C8AFCD535CDA9F.description: describe opportunities they have had to demonstrate enterprising and entrepreneurial characteristics and skills

81246A56C97D4A74A7DB7F759EC07D5A.description: Self-assessment: assess their own entrepreneurial and enterprising potential.

2F9BCE89546B49A1A768E03541FDCFF4.description: describe the effect that changes brought about by entrepreneurs have had on the lives of people (e.g., workers, consumers, business people).

3475A929349F436F8E9A3806607300EB.description: describe how entrepreneurs have been agents of change (e.g., by developing new products, methods of production, and ways of doing business)

3C48E53CFA7A48CA9429DBE66FCCA813.description: describe the impact that local entrepreneurs have had on the community (e.g., by creating jobs, providing community leadership, funding scholarships)

B046306723D74C5F9D0C01E69E661DAC.description: outline the importance of incorporating ethical practices and social responsibility when operating a business venture

75E458F1BB68411595A5D5E16234AD27.description: identify the skills (e.g., negotiating, interpersonal, money management, selling) required for entrepreneurial success

106C683E8AD24B4A94100E2924F95637.description: compare the challenges and opportunities facing young entrepreneurs with those facing adult entrepreneurs

8917E71C966A4554A6B5E1AC53B05C4F.description: distinguish between an entrepreneur and an enterprising person

DAC2D165827E47358CA20B9199DC11A0.description: develop a profile of a typical entrepreneur by researching a diverse group of successful entrepreneurs, including Aboriginal entrepreneurs

00D9EC54AFB6490A988D00C3EE00760D.description: Characteristics and Contributions of an Entrepreneur: compare the characteristics and contributions of various entrepreneurs

68F69148D63140F9BF959D5D6CEC4304.description: explain how they can use and develop their skills in enterprising ways (e.g., giving art or music lessons, coaching sports).

184C0701255F42CCB1EFF362C5670B51.description: analyse the personal benefits of being an enterprising person

BAEA9038143E470B8C4A48C645EE7F0F.description: develop a profile (e.g., characteristics, skills, motivations, abilities, attitudes, aptitudes, contributions) of an enterprising person
